section.title: Compiling documentation
section.para: After editing any of the XML files, you should compile the HTML files to make sure they still look reasonable. The Makefile, in the directory of the document you are editing, is setup to create two diffrent types of output:

listitem.para: A directory (html.d) of html files, one for each chapter and section ("make html_dir" or "make")
A single html file containing the entire documentation ("make html_file")

section.para: The default is to compile a directory of html files. Running "make all" will compile both output formats. Running "make clean" will remove all generated files.

The above discription only works on Unix and Linux (and perhaps on Mac). If you have Windows, you need to have the following packages:

listitem.para: Windows ports of libxml2, libxslt, iconv and zlib: http://www.zlatkovic.com/libxml.en.html

section.para: Curently there is no support for compiling the documentation on Windows.
